title: Cold and Marooned in a Police State as Desperation Takes Hold
content: Almost a dozen migrants have died in recent weeks in the standoff between Belarus, a close ally of Russia, and Poland, a member of NATO and the European Union, each determined not to bend.

more_info.byline: By Andrew Higgins and Marc Santora
des_facet: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis

title: A Border Crisis
content: The situation at the Belarus-Poland border is unlike recent immigration crises.

title: How Leather Seats in Luxury SUVs Fuel Amazon Deforestation
content: An examination of Brazil’s immense tannery industry shows how hides from illegally deforested ranches can easily reach the global marketplace. In the United States, much of the demand for Brazilian leather comes from automakers.

more_info.byline: By Manuela Andreoni, Hiroko Tabuchi, Albert Sun and Victor Moriyama

title: How a Cure for Gerrymandering Left U.S. Politics Ailing in New Ways
content: Independent commissions to oversee the redrawing of electoral maps were thought to be the solution to an age-old problem. Instead, they have become bogged down in political trench warfare.

more_info.byline: By Nick Corasaniti and Reid J. Epstein

title: Want a Clue About the 2022 Midterm Elections? Look at 2 Ohio Races.
content: Neither race received much national attention, but there’s a long history of special election results foreshadowing the next general election.

title: The N.Y. Governor’s Race Is Wide Open, and Democrats Are Rushing In
content: Jumaane Williams, the New York City public advocate, became the latest Democrat to enter the 2022 race for governor.

more_info.byline: By Nicholas Fandos and Katie Glueck

title: Mass Detentions of Civilians Fan ‘Climate of Fear’ in Ethiopia
content: An ethnically motivated detention campaign largely targeting Ethiopians of Tigrayan descent threatens to further unravel Africa’s second-most populous country a year into a civil war.

title: Frida Kahlo Self-Portrait Sells for $34.9 Million
content: The sale at Sotheby’s on Tuesday was a benchmark for Kahlo and was the most valuable work of Latin American art ever sold at auction.

title: Investors Hung Their Hats on Peloton and Zoom Last Year. What Now?
content: Some “stay-at-home” stocks that were pandemic-era darlings have experienced brutal sell-offs.

title: The Tech Gifts That Are Hard to Buy This Holiday Season
content: The list of scarce gadgets is long, driven by a chip shortage. Don’t wait until Black Friday for the best deals.

title: Up, Up and Away: The Trippy Tales Behind ‘Flying Over Sunset’
content: How’s this for an unlikely idea for a musical? Three 1950s celebrities, including Cary Grant, experimenting with LSD. Together. It happened, sort of.

title: Looking for a Stolen Idol? Visit the Museum of the Manhattan D.A.
content: Investigators have seized so many looted artifacts — more than 3,000 — that storing and caring for them until they can be returned is now a full-time job.

title: 12 Wines for Thanksgiving and Beyond
content: The characteristics that make a bottle great for the holiday work for just about any occasion. These wines not only taste good, they feel good.

title: This Is What Happened When the West Looked Away From My Country
content: Bosnia and Herzegovina is on the brink of breaking up.

title: Why Is It So Dangerous to Be Pregnant in America?
content: Especially for women of color.

more_info.byline: By Sema K. Sgaier and Jordan Downey

title: Democrats Shouldn’t Panic. They Should Go Into Shock.
content: ‘No administration is going to thrive in that economic environment.’

title: Is It Time to Abandon the Idea of an ‘Asian American’ Identity?
content: Two Asian Americans question the term and its value.

title: Want to Save the Earth? We Need a Lot More Elon Musks.
content: To slow climate change, Father Profit and New Tech must innovate, fast.

title: The Federal Bureau of Dirty Tricks
content: Donald Trump was right to fire James Comey.

des_facet: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

title: ‘Woke’ Went the Way of ‘P.C.’ and ‘Liberal’
content: Progressives can still fall back on ‘progressive.’

title: ‘Everyone’s a Suspect.’ Six Former Israeli Soldiers Speak on Their Time in Hebron.
content: The director Rona Segal learned filmmaking in the Israeli army. Now she turns the camera on her fellow soldiers.

title: I Warned the Democrats About Inflation
content: Why didn’t they listen?

title: Policy and the Fog of Politics
content: What do voters actually know about government and the economy?

title: When Can the U.S. Declare Victory Over Covid?
content: This pandemic winter won’t be like the last one — but it won’t be “normal,” either.

title: Democratic Socialists Need to Take a Hard Look in the Mirror
content: Our beliefs just might not be as popular as we like to think they are.

title: Are We Witnessing the Mainstreaming of White Power in America?
content: A historian of the white power movement discusses Jan. 6, Tucker Carlson and the threat of politically motivated violence.

title: ‘We Finally Have Something to Celebrate’: The Infrastructure Bill Is Signed
content: Readers hail the $1 trillion bill but bemoan the partisanship and worry about online scams. Also: Paid family leave; court logjam; food deliveries.

title: The School Board Wars, Part 2
content: Meetings of the Central Bucks school board devolve into ugly fights and a bitter election is nearing. But what’s actually happening in classrooms?

more_info.byline: By Michael Barbaro, Eric Krupke, Jessica Cheung, Lisa Tobin and Chris Wood

title: What the Metaverse Sounds Like to Hans Zimmer
content: The composer discusses how streaming and A.I. are transforming movie music.

title: From Electric Bikes to ‘Tree Equity,’ Biden’s Social Policy Bill Funds Niche Items
content: The Build Back Better Act’s marquee provisions have been the focus, but Democrats have swept dozens of obscure measures and special interest breaks into the $1.85 trillion bill.

title: An Indigenous Women’s Softball Team Beats Opponents, and Machismo
content: A Mayan team from a small community on the Yucatán Peninsula has caused a sensation by excelling as its athletes play barefoot and wear traditional dresses, breaking barriers with every game.

more_info.byline: By Adam Williams and Marian Carrasquero

title: NASA Astronaut to Be First Black Woman to Join Space Station Crew
content: Jessica Watkins, who joined NASA’s astronaut corps in 2017, is scheduled to fly to the orbital outpost in a SpaceX capsule in April.

title: Clarissa Eden, British Countess and Political Influencer, Dies at 101
content: The iconoclastic niece of Winston Churchill, she was married to Prime Minister Anthony Eden, who was at the helm during the Suez crisis.

title: As Rittenhouse Awaits Verdict, Man Shot by Kenosha Officer Heals Slowly
content: When Jacob Blake was partially paralyzed last year, it set off civil unrest in Kenosha, Wis. Jurors are now deliberating the fate of Kyle Rittenhouse, who killed two men during those protests.

title: L.A.’s Staples Center will be renamed Crypto.com Arena.
content: The rebranding, which will take effect on Christmas Day, is the latest example of a company at the center of a technology boom paying to rename a well-known sports arena.

title: Democrats Press for House Censure of Gosar for Violent Anime Video
content: The House is expected to vote to formally rebuke the Arizona Republican and strip him of his committee seats for the video depicting him attacking two Democrats.

title: Woman’s Body Recovered From Mudslide in British Columbia as Evacuations Continue
content: “It came down faster than the speed of sound,” said a woman who survived the mudslide. Heavy rainfall and overflowing rivers have inundated cities in the Canadian province.

more_info.byline: By Christine Hauser, Christine Chung and Alyssa Lukpat

title: New Wrinkle in Ghislaine Maxwell Trial as Judge May Be Promoted
content: Senator Chuck Schumer will recommend Judge Alison J. Nathan for a seat on a federal appeals court, but the fraught case could put her in an unusual predicament.

title: Maryland Mayor Is Charged in ‘Revenge Porn’ Case
content: Andrew Bradshaw, the mayor of Cambridge, on the state’s Eastern Shore, posted nude photos of a former partner on Reddit, along with degrading comments and racial slurs, prosecutors said.

title: Kevin Durant Can Score From Anywhere. Defenses Don’t Know What to Do.
content: The midrange game has largely fallen out of favor in the N.B.A., but not when Durant is on the court.

title: Seven Immigrant Women Who Changed the Way Americans Eat
content: “Taste Makers,” by Mayukh Sen, features women who, often while confronting sexism and racism in the food industry, introduced Americans to the dishes of their native cultures.

title: How Psychologists Can Help Treat Chronic Pain
content: As doctors and patients worry about the effects of painkillers, therapists are finding they can be a powerful salve for suffering.

title: Tiny Love Stories: ‘I Only Sort of Hope He’s Happy’
content: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.

title: The 50 Best Movies on Netflix Right Now
content: Movies upon movies await, and you don't even have to drill down to find them.

title: Is There Such a Thing as ‘Traveler’s Constipation’?
content: Traveler’s constipation is probably real. And the scientific evidence behind it is fascinating.

title: Does It Matter if I Eat the Stickers on Fruits and Vegetables?
content: They won’t cause you any harm, but there are reasons to remove them before taking a bite.

title: Which Type of Medical Scan Is Right for Me?
content: CT, M.R.I. and ultrasound scans offer different advantages and drawbacks.

title: Does Fidgeting Counter the Harmful Effects of Sitting?
content: Any movement, no matter how slight, counts as physical activity and can be good for your health.

title: Why Was My Doctor Visit Suddenly So Expensive?
content: The facility fee may be to blame for the added costs of a doctor visit.
